DOCUMENT A * Appendix:
Here are the pros and cons listed by some of you in correspondence, passed along in
one way or another by others* If I miss any, please forgive me* I am listing all I
can find, all I can think of that have been advanced in earlier times. One thing I
do hope, for good of NAEB, is that we consider all of the proposals objectively,
dispassionately....that we arrive at some conclusions by vote at the convention...
that whatever the vote is at the convention, we abide by said decision, say for one
year at least. If I have failed to list any major proposal, I apologize. I have not
done so intentionally. I have no objections to the convention considering other
changes, but I would like to know as far in advance as possible. And, such consider¬
ation ivill require unanimous consent for consideration. For good and valid proposals,
I'm sure we can get it. Now, after you have studied proposals, if you have questions,
comments, and jet-propelled criticisms, I'll welcome them. Here goes me:
Re: Proposals A. B. and C. PRO: (l) Present name does not indicate
enough the inclusion of both radio and television broadcasters. (2) NAEB has been
used by National Association of Educational Buyers since 1920.
CON: (l) NAEB has been used for years.
(2) NAEBroadcasters includes both radio broadcasting and television broadcasting, see
Webster for broadcasting. (3) It isn't the name that counts anyhow. It's what we
are and do and stand for.
Re: Proposal D. PRO: (l) A more equitable voting system should be worked
out. This does it. It provides for voting, based upon extent of service given.
(2) It provides for voting regulations of institutions having three or more stations
by limiting voting power to three.
CON: (l) It further confuses voting methods. (2) What's
wrong with present method, or the old one of one vote each.
Re: Proposal E. PRO: (l) This gives the Associate Member a vote as well
as a voice. (2) Associate Members should have a vote because of their mutual inter¬
est, mutual efforts in education by radio and television.
CON: (l) Associates have a voice, they don't need a
vote. (2) Adoption of Proposal "I" will give the Associate Members real representa¬
tion, a better voice than voting on all business matters.
Re: Proposal F. PRO: (l) Simply makes section consistent with possible
action on Proposal E.
CON: (1) Hear I a Con?
Re: Proposal G. PRO: (l) We need more than six regions, but there should
be some limit. (2) Right now, Region Six (or District VI) feels it is too large,
and not as workable as if it were divided, or re-districted. The limit of six makes
it difficult for Board to adjust because presently Board can create only six
regions (districts).
CON: (l) Board will be getting too big.
Re: Proposal H. PRO: (l) This simply provides for actives or associates
to hold office and indicates terms for Directors and years of election.
